entry.title: Two Sum
entry.content: Given an array of integers, find two numbers such that they add up to a specific target number. The function twoSum should return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to the target, where index1 must be less than index2. Please note that your returned answers (both index1 and index2) are zero-based. http://www.lintcode.com/problem/two-sum/ Solution #1 - Brute Force search. O(n) Space, O(n^2) time 1234567891011121314class Solution: """ @param numbers: An array of Integer @param target: target = numbers[index1] + numbers[index2] @return: [index1, index2] (index1 < index2) """ def twoSum(self, numbers, target): for i, n in enumerate(numbers): for j, m in enumerate(numbers[i+1:], i+1): if n + m == target: return [i, j] return [-1, -1] Solution #2 - Double pointer. O(n) Space, O(nlogn)time Solution #3 - Hash. O(n) Space, O(n)time 12345678910111213class Solution: """ @param numbers: An array of Integer @param target: target = numbers[index1] + numbers[index2] @return: [index1, index2] (index1 < index2) """ def twoSum(self, numbers, target): d = {} for i in range(len(numbers)): if target - numbers[i] in d: return [d[target - numbers[i]], i] d[numbers[i]] = i return [-1, -1]

entry.title: Personal Growth Summary - Sept 2017
entry.content: Overview Rating Score Sum 163 Weekly Average 40.75 Daily Average 6.79 Percentage 67.92% Compared to Last Month +6 Designed System structure of SugAR Poke. Spent wonderful time with Dr. Qin in Philadelphia and in Boston. Great tennis improvement in pace, timing and forehand. Project Finished: System structure of SugAR Poke. Essence of calculus. English Pronunciation, finished 10 vowels and 16 consonants. Regular Expression Marcia funebre sulla morte di Luigi van Beethoven, Op. 146, written by Carl Czerny Body weight: 173.6lb, 1.6lb away from the goal; waistline: 83cm, exceeded the goal 84cm Sept 2017: Monthly goal ReviewStudy ✗ Deep Learning - The Straight Dope, bu Mu Li.✗ Deep learning, by Andrew Ng.✓ Essence of calculus, by 3Blue1Brown.✗ Algorithms and Data Structures, by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne, 40%.✗ Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures using Python, by BM and DR, 50%.✗ One web crawler with python project.✓ Marcia funebre sulla morte di Luigi van Beethoven, Op. 146, written by Carl Czerny. Social ✓ Join one Data Scientist hiking trip.✗ Join one big meetup(AI, Python relating).✗ Join one Kaggle competition. Energy Management ⍻ Important first and plan ahead.⍻ More than 3 hours on All Productive Time, Less than 1.5 hours on All Distracting Time.✗ Play tennis less than four hours/week.✓ HIIT/Stretch and meditate in the morning and evening.✓ Read books on Kindle.✗ Reduced body weight from 176 to 172lb.✓ waistline from 88cm to 84cm. Oct 2017: Monthly Goal PlanningStudy Deep learning, by Andrew Ng. Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures using Python, by BM and DR, One web crawler with python project. Fon-Fon, by Nazareth, Ernesto. Social Go Back to Worcester once for Piano Class and friends Energy Management Important first and plan ahead. More than 5 hours on All Productive Time, Less than 1.5 hours on All Distracting Time, including social media and news. Play tennis less than four times/week, less than 1.5 hour each time. HIIT/Stretch and meditate in the morning and evening. Read books on Kindle. Practice English pronunciation while driving. Reduced body weight from 173 to 170lb, waistline from 83cm to 80cm. Things Need to Improve Important FIRST. Make more DETAILED plans. Meditate more, especially when feeling not right. A Few ThoughtsWinter is coming. Found out I am suffering from SAD(Seasonal affective disorder) which made me sleep more but disrupted, eat more but exercise less, hesitate more but do less. :PMeditation really helps to improve focus, self-esteem and the whole mental status. Stay focused, keep mindful.

On the way back from Mount Monadnock, the four Peking University Alumni gave me a really good lesson. They conveyed beauty through vivid language, detailed description, and being the scenes. Got crazy about tennis. Does this mean I was lost? Remember Knowledge as Action.知行合一. Trying to apply mindfulness into every thing. I found that the mobile phone and computer are the things really limit our imagination. So many thoughts came out of my mind after I let it free. Mindfulness, to be continued…

entry.title: Personal Growth Summary - August 2017
entry.content: OverviewMonthly Rating: 157 / 4Weekly: 39.25Daily average: 5.61 Congratulation, First Month accomplished!Started to work, settled down in a Brighton and everything is back on track. Project Finished: Built PandaonMars. Started my own Brand! Reviewed Linear Algebra. Highly recommend this series Essence of linear algebra. This guy visualized all 2D and 3D matrix transformation which provides a clear and visual understanding. Python Course, by Codeacademy New job New apartment and roommates, start a new chapter. Everything is going in the right direction. Monthly GoalSocial Join one Data Scientist hiking trip.Join one big meetup(AI, Python relating).Join one Kaggle competition. Study Deep Learning - The Straight Dope, bu Mu Li.Deep learning, by Andrew Ng.Essence of calculus, by 3Blue1Brown.Algorithms and Data Structures, by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne, 40%.Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures using Python, by BM and DR, 50%.One web crawler with python project.Marcia funebre sulla morte di Luigi van Beethoven, Op. 146, written by Carl Czerny. Energy Management Important first and plan ahead.More than 3 hours on All Productive Time, Less than 1.5 hours on All Distracting Time.Play tennis less than four hours/week.HIIT/Stretch and meditate in the morning and evening.Read books on Kindle.Reduced body weight from 176 to 172lb, waistline from 88cm to 84cm. Things Need to Improve Important FIRST Make more DETAILED plans A Few ThoughtsWhile thinking about how to write monthly summary, I noticed my flaws. I have a long-term goal – becoming a data scientist, but short-term goal is not clear enough, which breaks the rule – make detailed plans. Thus, I added monthly goal in the summary. Set the goal, review it and analyse why I achieved or not. Find out the real reason according First Principle, that’s the most important thing. It is the first step that costs troublesome, but I already started sailing. Winter is coming :P. I used to turn into hibernation mode during winter time, but this time I want to try if I can keep my energy level as high as in summer. Consider this as my goal in the winter.

entry.title: Week Two Summary
entry.content: OverviewRating: 29/7 Received my first offer, found a new apartment, moving in next week. Project Finished: New job. New apartment and roommates, start a new chapter. Project Working On: Python Course, by Codeacademy, 61%Algorithms and Data Structures, by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne, 10%Essence of calculus, 15%English Pronunciation, start vowel exerciseMarcia funebre sulla morte di Luigi van Beethoven, Op. 146, written by Carl Czerny, 70%Tennis serve, successful rate 80% Project Planning Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures using Python, by Brad Miller and David RanumDeep learning, by Andrew NgStatistics One, by Andrew ConwayReduce Body weight from 180 to 170lb, waistline from 91cm to 81cm in three months Things Need to Improve More detailed timetable. Plan earlier and decide sooner. Daily Rating Criteria Subject - Score Important thing FIRST - 2 Plan ahead, detailed plan - 1 Java, Python at least two algorithms - 3 Piano - half hour - 1 HIIT - Twice a day - 1 English Pronunciation - 1 Time spent on Weibo under 15mins, WeChat under 1 hour - 1 A Few Thoughts I received and accepted the first offer. At least it’s a start. Took me almost four hours/day to look for a new apartment, including go through Craigslist, send e-mail, and driving to see the area and apartment. It put off other projects, but in the long run, this one week effort can save more time for commute. This week’s activity raises the following question:How to efficiently use fragmented time? Collect thoughts actively Think ahead, plan ahead Detailed timetable Most Important FITST Focus on the present moment Knowledge as Action.

entry.title: My First Network Meeting - Boston New Technology Meetup
entry.content: This is my first meetup meeting, encouraged by professor Brian. I wouldn’t have known meetup if he didn’t recommend to me. Also, he is the first person who recommended toastmaster, the best club to practice public speaking and critical thinking. My goal is talking with 10 people and ended up at 11, and one resume was sent. I enjoyed the meetup and learned a lot from these wonderful people. However, I could have done better the followings: Conduct more research. I only searched for six startup companies. Include other people next time. Limit time for each person in five mins. If I find out he/she is not my target, try to wrap up the conversation and find next. Deliver a better pitch. People want to see the real “me”, get a better hook. Think about their pain, ask them and provide my solution. This one really needs more time and perspective to achieve, but it can be trained. Overall, it’s a well-organized, vigorous meetup. People who are pursuing the same goal get together. I am looking forward to next meeting.

entry.title: Blog Intro
entry.content: In Sitcom Seinfeld, George used to say “it’s about nothing.” Actually doing nothing is doing everything. Wu Wei 无为 is a similar philosophy thought in Dao De Jing[^1]. This blog will be everything, not only about me also others. I want to depict a vivid picture of me; I want to record my presentation in every toastmaster, every piece of music I play; I want to see my spiral growth path when I am doing weekly/monthly/yearly summary; I want to keep every shining idea so I can review and polish it; I want to share my joy and sadness, up and down, success and failure. It will show you the real me. I believe in “If you don’t measure, you cannot improve” and “Facts do not cease exist because they are ignored.” But if you want to measure, you need to find out what to measure first. According to first principle and Dao, a basic, foundational, self-evident proposition or assumption will be the indicator. I will continuously find, measure, improve and train myself. This blog is the perfect place to conduct the field experiment. The world is evolving faster and faster, and We need to grow with it. As a Chinese saying, “It takes a decade to grow a tree, but a century to shape a mankind”, I want to keep moving forward with others and never stop. [^1]:If you are interested in this Chinese philosophy, please read this article Understand Chinese – Dao De Jing Introduction.

entry.title: Hello, New World - My First Blog
entry.content: New StartI am suuuuper excited! The idea starting a blog has been in my mind for a quite while, all kinds of reasons stopped me moving forward, lazy is the most :P. From earliest QQ zone, Renren, to Sina Blog, WeChat, Weibo and recently FB, Twitter…Half of them are already gone, and the left will be gone one day, but the blog will last longer than any of them. This is the mark I want to leave. Please look through Blog Intro for more information about my blog. Thank YouI want to thank the following people for supporting me: Professor Brian enlightened me to start my own brand Fzy-Line, detailed explanation about how to set up Hexo Hexo, a fast, simple & powerful blog framework. Also thanks to my parents forcing me to go abroad :P (they maybe never have a chance to look at this), GitHub for free domain，and the spirit of Internet - sharing. At lastThank all of you who visit my blog. Suggestions are more than welcome. I want to continuously improve and your advice will be truly valuable. Feel free to comment or e-mail me: qunwang.tony@gmail.com.
